msbt.message: Whoa! Why are you holding a shovel?! WHY WOULD YOU HAVESorry. I just got nervous thinking about you out theredigging and what you might findWhich would NOT be any one of 73 pitfall traps that have definitely NOT been buried all around the island.
You were walking around with an axe just now, huh, ?Axes are très handy for DIY. And for posing like a lumberjack in fall fashion catalogs.
I'm the WORST with slingshots. I've got le lousy aim and miss ALL the balloons.Eh, I'm way more of a melee girl anyway.

Ohmigosh! A wand?! Oh wow, I could do some FAB STUFF with a wand! I'd transform ALL the time. Like, I could be onstage singing and dancing, holding a wand, and le POOF! Instant costume change. The crowd's going to FREAK OUT!
Are you building roads, ?Oh! You could build a runway for fashion shows!Yeah! If you built that, I could strut my stuff for MILES!

Are you building cliffs, ?Ooooo, I could stage a concert on the edge of a cliff! That'd be so cool!At the end of the show, I'd jump off the cliff wearing a wingsuit! AND I'd hold sparklers while I flew away!
Are you working on MORE rivers? I love staring at rivers.Rivers are, like, these amazing little fish highways. Where are you going, fishies? Nobody knows!
A party popper? Way cool. You cannot have a party without a party popper!Particularly party poppers produced per precise protocols—perfectly providing predictable party pops!
Where'd you find this caveman elevator?!Ladders are a great way to explore the island and go places folks maybe don't expect you to!

You have a vaulting pole! I had one years ago. It was called a StickThing!The commercial has the best jingle. Listen! I know ALL the words♪ StickThing! Jumpin' over water! Screamin' through the sky! ♪♪ StickThing! Gets you where you're goin'! Always keeps you dry! ♪<10_10 />STICKTHING!<10_9 /> StickThing Inc. is not liable for slivers, dampness, or mounting ennui about a StickThing-free life.Heh. I'm going to be humming that song for hours.

Did you find the bug you were looking for? No? Well! Here's a tip!When you finally spot your target? Approachslowly.No sudden movementsNo weird noisesFocusonthebug<10_10 />THEN, BAM! NAIL 'EM WITH YOUR NET! JUST BOOOOOM!<10_10 />IT'S BUUUG TIME!<10_9 />Ooooh! You should yell that with every bug! IT'S BUUUG TIME!A catchphrase is important. That way folks know you're a professional!
Bugs! They have ears! Little ones. That's why the old saying goes "Sneaky feetles catch the beetles."But I always forget that advice and I blab to myself as I get close. Scares them off every time.
There are some bugs that'll hide just as soon as you see them!The trick isif you can't see the bugs, then they can't see you!
! You are, like, SO good at catching bugs! I'm kind of jealous
WOW! Look at the bug catcher of the year! I am so excited for you right now, you know?
You're looking very sporty today, ! Walking around with your fishing rod and stuff!That's a pretty cool fashion look! I'm going to try it out. Oooo, maybe I'll do an album of fishing songs!
When I see a big fish's shadow in the water, I always run up to it like they're my favorite pop star!Fish are shy, though, so they usually bolt. Just like my favorite pop stars

Did you catch the fish you were looking for? What kind of fish are common this time of year again?You can tell me, but I'd probs forget. I'm not suuuuper into fishing, but it looks crazy fun! Let's go sometime!
I see you with that rod. You look so confident! Like, if you saw a fish in a river, you'd totally know what to do.HANG ON! You've already caught HOW many fish?! You're totally amazing, !
You've caught every type of fish, ? TRÈS COOL!

That umbrella is AMAZING!<10_4 /> Waiton a sunny day like this? That's actually a parasol, right?I always have problems deciding if I want an umbrella or a parasol. Function or fashion, you know? I mean, I totes always end up going with fashion. Who wants to be dry, but look lousy doing it?
That umbrella's le super cute! When you have a fab umbrella, rainy-day walks are tons more fun!
You don't get as wet in the snow as you do in the rain, but you still want to protect your clothes, right?
I used to be like, "Snow? Do I need an umbrella in the snow? Do folks even DO that?"Some folks DO use umbrellas during blizzards. Which is a thing that I did not know!
Are you out watering plants, ?Flowers practically sparkle after you water them. You can just tell they're excited for the hydration, you know?
You're way into the whole putting-water-on-things scene, huh, ?Between you and the sky juice, those flowers must be très happy, !
